course_title: Special Topics in Linguistics: Language Policy and Planning
class_notes: This course focuses on the study of Language Policy and Planning (LPP) and will address various theoretical approaches, research contexts, and applications. In this course, we will address the management or planning efforts by nations and institutions to influence language use as well as how individuals create, reproduce, and respond to policies. As we address LPP from different contexts (society, community, and individual), we will explore the objectives and expected outcomes found within the policies. Further, this course will use case studies to familiarize learners with the methodologies and approaches that support LPP research and the opportunity to apply them in practice.
course_description: Investigation of a particular issue or topic in the study of language, linguistics, and communication. May be repeated when topic varies. Topics may include: the Romance languages; intercultural communication; words and the world; language and human nature.
